title: save -r doesn't save inside yet to be added (in the same call) subdataset, requires second call

labels.name: severity-wishlist
labels.description: feature request, or bugs that are very difficult to fix due to design issues

body:
Minimal example. You can see that on 2nd run of `save` it would add that file.

<details>
<summary>longer example - but apparently superds is not needed to exhibit bug</summary>

```
/tmp > datalad create superds && cd superds && datalad create -d . testds && cd testds && mkdir -p subds1 && touch subds1/file && datalad create -f -d subds1
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/superds 
create(ok): /tmp/superds (dataset)                                                                                               
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/superds/testds 
add(ok): testds (file)                                                                                                           
add(ok): .gitmodules (file)
save(ok): . (dataset)
create(ok): testds (dataset)
action summary:
  add (ok: 2)
  create (ok: 1)
  save (ok: 1)
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/superds/testds/subds1 
create(ok): . (dataset)                                                                                                          

/tmp/superds/testds > datalad save -r -d^ subds1
add(ok): subds1 (file)
add(ok): .gitmodules (file)
save(ok): testds (dataset)
add(ok): testds (file)
save(ok): . (dataset)
action summary:
  add (ok: 3)
  save (ok: 2)

/tmp/superds/testds > datalad save -r -d^ subds1
add(ok): file (file)
save(ok): testds/subds1 (dataset)
add(ok): subds1 (file)
save(ok): testds (dataset)
add(ok): testds (file)
save(ok): . (dataset)
action summary:
  add (ok: 3)
  save (ok: 3)

/tmp/superds/testds > datalad save -r -d^ subds1
action summary:
  save (notneeded: 3)

/tmp/superds/testds > datalad --version
datalad 0.12.0rc6.dev198
```
</details>

```shell
exit:1 /tmp > datalad create testds && cd testds && mkdir -p subds1 && touch subds1/file && datalad create -f -d subds1 
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/testds 
create(ok): /tmp/testds (dataset)                                                                                                
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/testds/subds1 
create(ok): . (dataset)                                                                                                          

/tmp/testds > datalad save -r -d^ subds1                                                                               
add(ok): subds1 (file)
add(ok): .gitmodules (file)
save(ok): . (dataset)
action summary:
  add (ok: 2)
  save (ok: 1)

/tmp/testds > datalad save -r -d^ subds1
add(ok): file (file)
save(ok): subds1 (dataset)
add(ok): subds1 (file)
save(ok): . (dataset)
action summary:
  add (ok: 2)
  save (ok: 2)
```

<details>
<summary>
and it is the `-d` specified which affects it (`-d.` is as "good"):
</summary>

```shell
/tmp > datalad create testds && cd testds && mkdir -p subds1 && touch subds1/file && datalad create -f -d subds1
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/testds 
create(ok): /tmp/testds (dataset)                                                                                                
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/testds/subds1 
create(ok): . (dataset)                                                                                                          

/tmp/testds > datalad save -d. -r subds1                                                                               
add(ok): subds1 (file)
add(ok): .gitmodules (file)
save(ok): . (dataset)
action summary:
  add (ok: 2)
  save (ok: 1)

/tmp/testds > datalad save -d. -r subds1
add(ok): file (file)
save(ok): subds1 (dataset)
add(ok): subds1 (file)
save(ok): . (dataset)
action summary:
  add (ok: 2)
  save (ok: 2)
```
</details>
